1F8.F.summary: Fincantieri S.p.A. operates in the shipbuilding industry. The company operates in three segments: Shipbuilding; Offshore and Specialized Vessels; and Equipment, Systems and Services. The Shipbuilding segment designs and constructs cruise ships; ferries, including cruise, Ro-Pax, and due fuel ferries; naval vessels, such as aircraft carriers, destroyers, frigates, corvettes, patrol vessels, amphibious and logistic support ships, multirole and research vessels, special vessels, and submarines; and mega yachts, as well as expedition cruise vessels. The Offshore and Specialized Vessels segment designs and constructs offshore support vessels, specialized ships, and vessels for offshore wind farms and open ocean aquaculture, as well as other products in the field of drill ships and semi-submersible drilling rigs. This segment also provides electrical systems, including engineering, manufacturing, installation, integration testing, and commissioning services. The Equipment, Systems and Services segment provides stabilization, propulsion, and positioning and power generation systems; ship automation systems, steam turbines, and ship accommodation systems; entertainment systems and steel structures; cabins and public areas; catering; and electric, electronic, and electromechanical integrated systems. This segment also offers ship repairs, refitting, refurbishment, conversions, and product lifecycle management services, as well as after-sales support services. In addition, it is involved in the dry-dock management; project management; accommodation installation; and pipe installation. Further, the company provides electrical parts, technical and logistics engineering services, and ship interiors. It primarily serves ship owners and the defense sector worldwide. The company was founded in 1959 and is based in Trieste, Italy. Fincantieri S.p.A. is a subsidiary of CDP Industria S.p.A.

2ZP.F.summary: Avio S.p.A., through its subsidiaries, engages in the construction and development of space launchers, and solid and liquid propulsion systems for space travel in Italy and internationally. The company offers propulsion boosters, liquid oxygen turbo pumps, and aerodynamic control surfaces, motors, as well as tactical products, such as sensor block and ECU. It offers space launchers under the VEGA and ARIANE names. Avio S.p.A. has a strategic partnership with SoftInWay Group Inc. to develop new propulsion systems for small satellite launchers. The company was founded in 1984 and is based in Rome, Italy.

FINMF.summary: Leonardo S.p.a. engages in the helicopters, defense electronics and security systems, aeronautics, space, and other businesses in Italy, the United Kingdom, rest of Europe, the United States, and internationally. It researches, designs, develops, produces, supports, and markets a range of helicopters for commercial, public service, and security and defense applications. The company also offers multi-mission, tactical transport, combat, and trainer aircraft; airborne solutions, such as components, airborne sensors, and effectors in the electromagnetic spectrum, as well as ISR/information/intelligence, surveillance, targeting acquisition, and reconnaissance; unmanned aerial systems; and aero structures. In addition, it provides command, control, communications, and computers solutions for the digital battlefield; air defense solutions; air traffic control and management; vehicle systems; land weapon systems; soldier systems; force protection and border control products; radars; communication products; optronics; electronic warfare products; and unmanned systems for land operations. Further, the company offers command and control, maritime domain awareness, and weapon systems for sea; and cyber and digital solutions, professional communications, operation and control products, and handling systems. Additionally, it provides services and infrastructures, space and alliance, payloads and equipment, and programs for space, as well as services and trainings. The company was formerly known as Leonardo Â Finmeccanica S.p.a. and changed its name to Leonardo S.p.a. in January 2017. Leonardo S.p.a. was founded in 1948 and is headquartered in Rome, Italy.

OS.MI.summary: Officina Stellare S.p.A. designs and produces telescopes, and opto-mechanical and aerospace instrumentation for ground and space based applications worldwide. It serves aerospace, defense, earth observation, astronomy and science research, and laser communication sectors. The company was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Sarcedo, Italy.
